quizzes.question:
What is the output of this code?
# puts "1"
puts "2"
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Comments[/h1]

Comments are lines of annotation within Ruby code that are ignored at program runtime. 
In Ruby, the [b]hashtag symbol[/b] is used to create a single-line comment.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" codeId="970"][b]#[/b] printing some text
puts "Hi there"[/code]
[note]Everything following the hashtag symbol on that line is ignored when the program is run.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to make a multi-line comment:
[!raw!]
{0}
this is a
comment
{1}
puts "Ruby rocks!"
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Comments[/h1]

You can also create multi-line comments.
Everything between the [b]=begin[/b] and [b]=end[/b] reserved words are considered a comment: [code format="rb" codeId="971"][b]=begin[/b]
   This comment
   spans multiple 
   lines
[b]=end[/b]
puts "Hello"[/code]
[note]Adding comments to your code is a good practice. It facilitates a clear understanding of the code for you and for others who read it.[/note]
